description:
We at Phung Horwood are locally based Commercial Real Estate Appraisers and Consultants serving the Greater Victoria Region and other areas of Lower Vancouver Island. We provide timely and detailed Market Value Appraisals, Insurance Appraisals and Depreciation Reports (Reserve Fund Studies). Together we have over 50 years of collective experience in the areas of commercial real estate valuation, financial projection and analysis and construction. We pride ourselves on providing well researched, high quality reports, which are consistent with the standards required by the Appraisal Institute of Canada (AIC) as well as the Real Estate Institute of Canada (REIC).
As a Real Estate Analyst at Phung Horwood you will assist in a wide variety of tasks that will provide a working knowledge of real estate valuation techniques as well as an introduction into the real estate sector. Phung Horwood is seeking an analytically oriented problem solver who has a keen interest in the area of real estate valuation.
Duties and Responsibilities:
· Conduct market research including reviewing, summarizing, and analyzing comparable sales and financials.
· Assist with the preparation of market study reports utilizing primary and secondary research.
· Assisting in site / building inspections for marketing and internal use.
· Assist in database updates in excel and CRM+ (property, company and contact information).
· Conduct a variety of research (financials, ownership, land use regulations, tenant and transaction information) utilizing internal and external resources.
· Shadow a Senior Appraiser to gain firsthand experience in appraisal processes and decision-making, while assisting with time management and scheduling to optimize workflow efficiency
· Additional administration duties may include scheduling inspections, managing deadlines, and following up with accounts receivables.
What we Offer:
· Excellent training and mentoring from appraisal professionals.
· Fun workplace environment with no two days the same.
Required Qualifications:
· Completed or in the process of a Business or Economics post-secondary education preferred.
· Experience conducting research and analysis along with the preparation of reports, research papers or other formal written material.
· Proficient in the use of MS Office, including Word and Excel.
· Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
· Strong organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail.
· Ability to handle multiple priorities and work under tight deadlines
Desired Qualifications:
· Interest in real estate including construction methodology, component costing, and financial forecasting.
· Experience conducting market research
Special Requirements
Valid driver's license
Canadian citizenship
Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted for further consideration.

description:
The future you want is within reach.
 
  At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry.
 
  We're also looking at what's next for you and how we can help you build a career you're proud of. As a student at PCL, you will get the opportunity for challenging work assignments in a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth.
 
  We are seeking Engineering Students, for our BC Region district, within our Canadian Buildings Division that are available for 4 months starting in May 2024. This position will be under the direct supervisor of the Project Manager.
 
  Here's how a Mechanical Engineering Student for our BC Region office contributes to our team:
 
  
   
     Responsibilities
   
   
    
      Coordinating work specific scope / trades
      Participating in project meetings
      Conducting deficiency walks
      Reviewing all contract documentation including architectural, structural, mechanical, electrical drawings and specifications.
      Producing and maintaining a shop drawing log for all electrical equipment or material submittals and/or samples.
      Pursuing applicable trades for timely submission or re-submissions.
      Assisting in reviewing and providing comments on shop drawings prior to submitting to the consultants.
      Soliciting input from the all the electrical and mechanical subtrades including equipment and material delivery dates for input into the schedule.
      Performing quality control inspections with the consultant and Project Managers.
    
   
  
  
   
     Qualifications
   
   
    
      Candidates must have a strong desire to work in a construction environment and prior field construction experience will be considered an asset.
      Application of various computer software programs will be required, including word processing, spreadsheet applications and drafting.
      Pursuing a mechanical engineering degree.
    
   
  
 
  Pay Range: $20-$26 PCL Student wages are determined individually for each student based on the number of completed school terms, relevant work terms, kind of role and work location.
 
 
   Next Step:
   
  
   Please note that candidates who have been selected to move forward to the next stage of the recruitment process will receive an email to complete a short online video interview.
  
 
 
  PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scene of vacations, careers, education and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.  The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.  PCL combines numerous pay and benefit strategies to provide a comprehensive and competitive total rewards package. Any salary range displayed by a job board is an estimate. Your salary, which considers your unique qualifications and experience, is just one component of the robust total rewards you'll enjoy at PCL. This may include an employee share purchase offering, discretionary annual performance bonus, comprehensive benefits and wellness programs, retirement plan plus matching, and career development programs.  Should you require an accommodation during the application process, please contact us at careers@pcl.com with the position and location you are interested in.  Together, we can build success and a better future. Let’s get started!

companyInfo/companyDescription: The University of Victoria (Commonly referred to as uVictoria or UVic) is the second oldest public research university in British Columbia. It is a research intensive university located in Greater Victoria, British Columbia, Canada (northeast of Victoria) with an enrollment figure of more than 20,000 students. The campus is known for its innovative architecture, beautiful gardens and mild climate. It attracts many students in part because of its size, its picturesque location, and its Cooperative Education, Earth & Ocean Sciences, Engineering, and Law programs. The university is also the province's second largest research institution and the nation's lead institution in the VENUS and NEPTUNE projects.

     One of the distinguishing characteristics of the University of Victoria is its commitment to experiential learning. Experiential learning has been shown to be a powerful way to engage students in their studies by providing them with opportunities to put theory into practice, make connections with professionals in the field and develop career related skills and competencies. The University of Victoria has one of the largest co-op programs in Western Canada, with more than 4,000 work placements every year in Canada and around the world. Our Career Services is an on-campus career development service that helps students, alumni, faculty and staff prepare for successful careers. Information about the Co-operative Education Program and Career Services is available at www.uvic.ca/coopandcareer. 
     This position provides secretarial and general assistance to the International, Indigenous and Accessibility Co-op and Career Programs. Intercultural competency, including a knowledge of cultural intelligence and Indigenous cultural competency (understanding of colonization, decolonization, and Indigenous ways of knowing and being) is an asset for all staff working within this portfolio.

     The Co-op and Career Assistant provides secretarial assistance and performs general administrative tasks. Responsibilities include responding to inquiries from students, faculty, staff and employers; processing job descriptions for posting; supporting interviews between students and employers; maintaining records; generating a variety of reports and statistics for review; recording and tracking various required forms and documentation; assisting with the scheduling of meetings; preparation and distribution of various mail-outs; producing correspondence; providing assistance with the coordination, marketing and promotion of on-campus events; tracking, reconciling and processing budget expenses, etc. 
     Co-op and Career Assistants work closely and collaboratively to ensure a consistent, high level of service across all Co-op and Career programs and services. Reporting to their assigned Associate Director, the Assistants may work to support other areas, as assigned, or required, based on operational requirements. 
    
   
   
    
     Job Requirements 
    
    
     Experience: 
     Must have a minimum of 2 years of recent experience in a similar position. 
     Related work experience should include: 
     
      Providing a range of clerical and customer service 
      Using standard office equipment and software (e.g., MS Office) 
      Using databases and spreadsheets
     
      
      Preference will be given to applicants with: 
     
      Experience working with Co-op programs and/or Career Services and/or at the University of Victoria 
      Experience with UVic information systems
     
      
      Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: 
     
      Strong clerical related technical skills, including ability to effectively learn, navigate and leverage a range of technologies. 
      Ability to process documentation with accuracy and attention to detail. 
      Strong communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to relate well and work effectively within a team environment, as well as the larger UVic community. 
      Financial skills including numeracy and basic mathematics. 
      Initiative, good organizational skills and the ability to work on a variety of projects both independently and as part of a team are essential. 
      Ability to multi-task, be resourceful and be able to handle multiple requests and challenges. 
      Ability to act effectively in a receptionist capacity and perform multiple tasks in a busy office environment with many interruptions.

  Operating on the ocean around the world from Victoria BC, Open Ocean Robotics is a rapidly growing start-up transforming how we understand our oceans through better data. We are leaders in solar-powered autonomous boats, also called Uncrewed Surface Vehicles (USVs), that voyage across a wide variety of challenging ocean environments.
 
  We are driven by a pioneering spirit to push boundaries and make the seemingly impossible possible. Together, we can achieve that goal, growing our team of highly skilled people and offering you the opportunity to tackle big challenges with solutions that make a difference.

 As a Sales and Marketing CO-OP Student, you will play a crucial role in supporting our sales, service, and marketing teams.    Strong customer service skills. 
   Desire to learn and contribute to the sales process.

In 2006, the seeds of aerial adventure were planted by WildPlay Ltd. co-founders Gord Ross and Tom Benson. As avid climbers and certified guides, paragliding pilots, and nature enthusiasts, the businessmen were eager to share their passion - and belief in life-changing outdoor adventures - with people from every walk of life.

With 15-years of professional guiding experience, Ross and Benson had witnessed all manner of personal evolution when people connected with the outdoors. Every mountain scaled and hillside crossed seemed to result in guests uncovering new abilities and self-confidence. The desire to help more people overcome self-perceived boundaries was strong; however, they were limited by the intimidating requirements and high level of commitment that came along with climbing-type activities.

A solution to limited access sprouted when Ross discovered "tree-to-tree" parks in Europe and South America. Through research and product-testing, the pair realized that suspended obstacles and games could deliver a challenging and personal outdoor experience to adults, teens, and kids, without the steep learning curve. Coining their idea the "Monkido® Aerial Adventure", the entrepreneurs knew they had found the way to unleash outdoor recreation.

Park development came next, and the co-founders knew that the right location would not only showcase Mother Nature, but would respect and champion her health. They established development and operations criteria that include innovative Element design techniques, high standards for minimizing or improving environmental impact, sensitive building practices, and careful site selection that continue as markers of their expanding list of Park locations today.

This is a temporary 4 month or 8 month co-op position intended for a student in university/college to gain work experience.
 
  This position is only available to students on an academic co-op term.
 
  We are looking to work with an up-and-coming digital marketing enthusiast to enhance their skills and earn real-world experience.
 
  Job Purpose Are you a creative spirit that knows how to tie content to objectives? Are you excited about the opportunity to work with a brand that loves to help people challenge themselves while having fun? You might be our next Digital Marketing Coordinator!
 
  The Digital Marketing Coordinator supports WildPlay's growth by creating marketing content and providing support for a variety of marketing activities. The Coordinator will work to ensure that WildPlay's brand standards and culture shine in our online and in-park presence.
 
  The Digital Marketing Coordinator is a highly focused person with strong attention to detail. Creative and adaptable, they love developing quality content that represents an exciting brand. Thriving in a collaborative environment, they apply initiative and work cohesively with others during busy times to ensure that content is delivered successfully. This means looking for opportunities where content can help us to carry our mission forward. We’re looking for someone who thinks critically about their work as it relates to objectives, not just an order-taker!
 
 
   Principal Accountabilities
   
  
   Creates and delivers digital content (photos, videos, graphics, copy writing, etc.) primarily for WildPlay’s Marketing
   team, but also for other departments as needed
   
  
   Creates short video content to be used in digital ad campaigns
   Ensures creative is in line with company brand and values
   Works closely with the marketing team to deliver requested materials
   Participates in marketing ideation sessions
   Collaborates with external vendors to deliver content in a timely and effective way
   Helps create and define the visual expression of WildPlay’s strategies and messages
   Supports with Social Media Management when required
   Experience/Skills/Attributes
   
  
   Skilled with Adobe Creative Suite (particularly Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro)
   Copywriting, particularly for digital platforms and advertising
   Comfortable working in Office 365 and communicating digitally
   Experience developing videos in a variety of styles, such as interviews, advertising and educational
   Strong detail orientation and organizational skills
   Positive and enthusiastic attitude in interaction with internal and external stakeholders
   Ability to travel (during key events and shoots) to document and create content
   Strong editing skills in post-production
   Aware of general marketing principles regarding the use of digital content
   Ability to quickly adapt to change and effectively prioritize competing deadlines
   Existing knowledge of the tourism and/or adventure park industry is an asset
  
 
 
  Work Schedule Flexible, according to the needs of the business. It is primarily situated at WildPlay Ltd. Park Services office in Victoria BC, with occasional requirements to work at off-site locations. Remote work supported but in-person collaboration in Victoria is preferred – WildPlay has moved to a flexible, hybrid of style of work.
 
  Context This role is vital in driving successful outcomes for the WildPlay Network and is a key driver in ensuring that marketing and sales programs produce high-quality, measured results while sticking to established brand guidelines. This role can also help us to discover the value of video in other aspects of the business.
 
  The position reports to the Marketing Manager.
 
  This position is only available to students on an academic co-op term.

Your company, your values, your career! 

 Coast Hotels is a dynamic and growing brand. Our culture is rooted in our values, leadership accountability, and the growth and development of our Ambassadors. 

 Coast Victoria Hotel & Marina by APA is currently seeking co-op Students for summer Room Attendant positions! 
Please note that only co-op students are eligible for these positions, other applicants will not be considered. 

 The Room Attendant will contribute to the overall success of the hotel by ensuring that the Coast Hotels cleanliness and hygiene standards are consistently met for all guest room at the Hotel. This position will also be responsible for maintaining a positive work environment in the housekeeping area while maintaining high internal/external customer service standards. 

 We offer a benefits program as unique as you are! 

 
 
 Earn competitive wages 
 Paid extended medical, dental benefit (dependent on hours worked) 
 Enjoy generous employee discounts on rooms and meals 
 Get recognized and earn gift cards for outstanding performance with programs such as Ambassador of the Month and Coast Kudos 
 Celebrate Ambassador birthdays, anniversaries and life milestones with us 
 Daily Responsibilities:
 
 
 Always follow Coast Hotels policies, procedures and brand standards 
 Reviews room assignments with the Housekeeping Supervisor at the beginning of every shift 
 Makes sure that the housekeeping cart is fully stocked at the beginning and end of each shift, and that all needed supplies and equipment are in good working order 
 Inspects the appearance of each assigned guest room and notifies the Housekeeping Supervisor of any damage, malfunctions or discrepancies 
 Cleans guest rooms according to Coast Hotels guidelines and practices 
 Strips and changes linens in assigned guest rooms making sure they are presented in line with Coast Hotels brand standards 
 Cleans the bathrooms and makes sure that all room amenities and supplies are stocked, clean and placed neatly 
 Turns in all lost & found items to the Housekeeping Office immediately upon leaving an assigned floor 
 Sorts recyclable items according to Coast Hotels recycling program guidelines 
 Maintain a welcoming and friendly environment for guests and fellow ambassadors 
 Other duties as assigned and required by the Executive Housekeeper 
 Qualifications, Skills & Experience:
 
 
 Is committed to working safely, including adherence to safety regulations, hygiene and cleanliness 
 Attention to detail: working carefully to make sure nothing is missed 
 Time management & Multi-tasking: Able to perform a variety of different tasks, making sure to keep on track to complete all assigned rooms for each day 
 Physical requirements include the ability to lift, push and pull a minimum of 40 pounds, to stand and / or walk for an extended period of time, ability to stoop, kneel and reach, or perform repetitive foot and hand action, and the ability to bend at the waist 
 Excellent communication skills and able to work with a digital ticketing system to inform other departments of guest or hotel needs 
 Able to work a flexible schedule, which includes weekends and holidays 
 Exemplifies Coast’s core values: Win together, Expect Commitment, Live with Honour, Challenge the Limits, Act with Fairness 
 Prior hotel experience an asset but not a requirement 
 Coast Hotels offers a variety of benefits, including competitive wages & benefits, employee discounts, training & development, career advancement opportunities & more! 

 Coast Hotels is an Equal Opportunity Employer 
Coast Hotels would like to thank all interested applicants 
Only those selected for an interview will be contacted

Strength & Conditioning Coach Job at Speed Mechanics Victoria, BC
JOB TITLE: Strength and Conditioning Coach
LOCATION: Saanich, BC
ABOUT SPEED MECHANICS
Speed Mechanics is Victoria’s premier high-performance training facility focusing on developing young athletes’ speed, strength, and power by building confidence, perfecting foundational movement skills, and making increasingly challenging training fun. We focus on building robust, young athletes who can not only perform to their full potential but also fully grasp a deep understanding of the training that gets them there.
We not only work with athletes, but we work with the "every person" looking to improve their health and wellbeing by introducing them to foundational training principles and building a plan to suit their needs. We believe that everyone has an athlete within and it's a matter of exploring movement through sound training principles to unlock people's potential, keep them happy and healthy and able to enjoy life outside the gym.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Speed Mechanics is looking for a dynamic, engaging, and pro-active Strength and Conditioning Coach to join our Victoria team.
Our strength and conditioning coaches provide support to our various programs onsite and offsite. Strength and conditioning coaches also facilitate group training sessions, personal coaching, semi-private coaching, perform testing, collect data, and can be assigned to lead specific training groups/classes.
The right candidate will be able to work flexible hours, including morning and evening hours,and weekends.
Duties and expectations include, but are not limited to:
- Developing and supervising strength and conditioning programs for different populations.
- Acquiring new leads or prospective clients.
- Provide training plans for clients in-person and online as required.
- Bring forth new program ideas for classes and programs.
- Will report to the Lead S&C Coaches.
- Record and maintain strength and conditioning data.
- Supervise and conduct strength and conditioning sessions while ensuring the proper technique is utilized and hygiene/safety standards are followed.
- Coverage for other strength and conditioning staff away for travel and/or holiday.
- Upkeep of Speed Mechanics facility and equipment.
KEY SKILLS
Adaptability / Agility
Analytical Thinking
Communication
Leading
Interpersonal Skills
Planning
Teamwork
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Working towards (within 6 months to graduation) or completion of a Bachelors degree preferred in Kinesiology, Human Kinetics, Athletic Therapy, or related field.
Certified Strength & Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) certification, CSEP - Certified Personal Trainer or equivalent - Willing to obtain within 6 months.
NCCP Olympic Weightlifting or equivalent is considered an asset.
Background in sport as a former athlete or coach is considered an asset.
1-2 years of experience in personal coaching or team training is considered an asset.
First Aid & CPR-C is required.
Must have liability insurance.
*A criminal record check for the vulnerable sector will be required by the successful candidate

description:
If you’re looking to hit the ground running, the Enterprise Management Internship will help you build valuable business and leadership skills. For a university/college student, the real-world professional experience you’ll receive during the internship will help you stand apart from the crowd, and will be more than just a line on your resume.
  
 From day one as a paid intern with Enterprise, you'll learn what it takes to run a successful business and acquire highly marketable skills in management. Our university/college interns take on the same challenges as our first and second year full-time professionals. It's a team-based environment; and throughout your internship, your peers will be right by your side helping you learn, grow and have fun.
  
 This role is located in Downtown Victoria branch.
  Responsibilities:
  When you join our Management Internship Program, you'll soon discover that every day is different because it is filled with new, exciting, rewarding and often unexpected opportunities. For a season, we’ll put you in the middle of everything, just like our Management Trainees. We’ll give you the chance to develop the skills you need to manage a fleet of vehicles, take care of customers, develop marketing strategies and build relationships with customers and coworkers.
  
 During our internship, you’ll use the skills you learn to complete intern projects and engage in some friendly competition with your peers. You may also be eligible for performance incentives and employee referral rewards. 
  Qualifications:
  
 
 
   Must be at least 18 years of age.
   Must be a current university student graduating with a Bachelor's Degree on or before June of 2025.
   
     Students enrolled in business degree program are preferred.
   
   Must have valid class 5 driver's license with no more than three chargeable moving violations or accidents within the last three years.
   No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) in past 5 years.
   Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
   Must have a minimum of six months experience in sales, customer service, management or leadership.

Founded in 1866, The Sherwin-Williams Company is a global leader in the manufacture, development, distribution, and sale of paints, coatings and related products to professional, industrial, commercial, and retail customers. 

The company manufactures products under well-known brands such as Sherwin-Williams®, Valspar®, HGTV HOME® by Sherwin-Williams, Dutch Boy®, Krylon®, Minwax®, Thompson’s® Water Seal®, Cabot® and many more. Sherwin-Williams® branded products are sold exclusively through a chain of more than 4,100 company-operated stores and facilities, while the company’s other brands are sold through leading mass merchandisers, home centers, independent paint dealers, hardware stores, automotive retailers, and industrial distributors. 

Sherwin-Williams supplies a broad range of highly-engineered industrial and OEM coatings for wood and general industrial, coil, packaging, protective and marine, and transportation applications worldwide. 

Our 60,000 employees are diverse, innovative and passionate. With a variety of rewarding and challenging opportunities, Sherwin-Williams is a great place to find a career that takes you places.
description:
The Sherwin-Williams Management & Sales Internship is a PAID, 10-12-week summer program offering hands-on experience in management, sales, and store operations as well as meaningful customer experiences. Our store internship program is designed to provide you with a comprehensive learning experience through practical business-to-business and retail experience working in a paint store. You will gain insight into a career in outside sales by traveling with a Sales Representative and spending structured time with your management team. You will also complete a project that addresses critical business issues alongside your peers and with the support of leadership. 
      
      Our intern experience provides professional-level learning in the following areas: 
      Sales 
      Marketing/Promotions 
      Merchandising 
      Customer Relationship Management 
      Business Management 
      
      Following successful completion of the program, interns are highly encouraged to apply to the Management & Sales Training Program (“MTP”) and further grow their career with Sherwin-Williams! 
      
      College graduates are not eligible to participate in the internship program but are encouraged to apply to our Management and Sales Training Program (“MTP”) instead.
    
   
  
 
 

 

 


 
  Minimum Requirements: 
 
 
  
   Must be at least eighteen (18) years of age 
   Must be legally authorized to work in the country of employment without needing sponsorship for employment work visa status now or in the future 
   Must be enrolled in a college or university at the time of the internship or co-op program 
   Must be able, with or without reasonable accommodation, to retrieve material from shelves and floor stacks and lift and carry up to 50 lbs. frequently and up to 70 lbs. on occasion

   Have previous experience working in a team-oriented setting including work experience, extracurricular activities, military service, etc. 
   Ability to read, write, comprehend, and communicate in more than one language

description:
Are you a Civil Engineering student looking for a Co-Op Placement for 2024’s Summer and/or Fall Term? Metro Testing + Engineering provides opportunities for students who are looking to gain experience in their field of studies. You will gain valuable experience in construction materials engineering through working at our lab or on-site testing. We will help you to build a solid foundation in your future career.
Why choose us:
Choose us for your Co-Op term, and you will learn from our experienced engineers and technicians. They are ready to share their knowledge and experience with you and help you to make sense of your studies from school. You will gain real world engineering experience and expand your professional network in the construction industry. And who knows, you could be teaching us a thing to two!
Who we are:
Metro Testing & Engineering Ltd has over 30 years of experience providing materials testing and engineering consultation to the construction industry in BC. We have grown to having over 240 employees and 10 offices in Western Canada. As a CCIL Certified materials testing laboratory, we provide third party independent sampling and testing of construction materials for QC/QA purposes. As a consulting firm, we provide consulting services in Materials, Environmental and Geotechnical Engineering. As an employer, we provide a safe, balanced work environment, and are committed to maintaining an open and inclusive workplace culture.
Our Guiding Principles help instill certain values and culture within the company. People, Integrity, Commitment, Communication, Teamwork, and Guidance. These six principles are proudly displayed on the wall in every branch where our employees have signed their names on it as a commitment to those principles.

 Conducts various Human Resources functions, involving onboarding and orientation, performance management, policies and procedures.

 Assists in the creation of Workplace Culture Assessments and Investigations

 Special projects around Health and Safety, training / development, and streamlining orientation initiatives.

Knowledge, skills, and abilities:

 Ability to prioritize tasks, manage tight deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced environment;
 Working cooperatively/effectively with others to share best practices that enhance organizational effectiveness;
 Excellent communication, initiative, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills;
 MS Office skills and knowledge of spreadsheets
 Proven ability to prioritize, problem solve, exercise initiative, and work independently and as a team member; and
 Strong active listening skills, with the ability to uphold and maintain confidentiality.

Preferred Qualifications:

 Currently pursuing a career in Human Resources studies and/or a related field.
 Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with others both internally and externally.
 Exemplary communication skills; research skills; demonstrated writing skills and technology skills; and Strong active listening skills with the ability to uphold and maintain confidentiality.

Eligibility:

 Able to demonstrate initiative and self-motivation.
 All applicants must be between the ages of 15-30 at the beginning of employment.

Established in 1910, McElhanney is an employee-owned company that provides surveying, engineering, GIS & remote sensing, community planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. We have 30+ locations across Western Canada, and specialty satellite offices in Newfoundland and Labrador and Florida (USA), to service cities, communities & parks, energy & resources, and transportation sectors. We operate locally in the communities where we live and work and share staff resources from across our company.



At McElhanney, we work closely with our clients and partners and take on their challenges like they’re our own. Our clients choose us because of our commitment to safety and quality service, because our relationships are rooted in trust, and because our capable teams have the grit and skill to tackle challenging problems.



We value hiring and keeping great people, attaining operational excellence, and delivering outstanding work to our valued clients. It’s what drives us forward every day.
description:
About McElhanney 
Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,400 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals. 

 The Opportunity:
 Join our team as an HR Summer Student and immerse yourself in the dynamic world of Talent Management at McElhanney for a summer placement. This temporary position from May to August, will give you exposure to talent management as a specialty in the field of HR, experience in a professional services environment, and the opportunity to make an impact on our employee experience as we transition to skills-based hiring & employee development. 

 In this position, you will support McElhanney’s Talent Management team in employee engagement action planning, recruitment, and learning & career development resourcing. This position offers in-office options in three locations: Edmonton, Victoria, and Vancouver, with the additional flexibility for a hybrid work arrangement. 

 What You’ll Be Doing:
 
 
 Assist in curating and cataloguing skills-based employee development resources. 
 Support in the data analysis and execution of employee engagement action planning. 
 Collaborate with the recruitment team in developing and maintaining a new interview resource library and talent assessments. 
 Assist with people data analytics projects. 
 Support ad hoc HR projects and initiatives as needed. 
 Skills And Attributes For Success:
 
 
 Communication: Effectively communicate with a diverse group of colleagues to gather requirements and provide updates on project progress. 
 Manage relationships: Collaborate with internal teams to build trust and understand their needs. 
 Manage resources: Develop and implement strategies to optimize the allocation of your time and resources. 
 Business knowledge: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop internal resources that support the needs of the business. 
 Identify solutions: Identify areas for improvement through observation and feedback. 
 What You’ll Bring:
 
 
 Currently enrolled in a Master’s degree program in Human Resources. 
 Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality. 
 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. 
 Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Work, Excel, PowerPoint). 
 Hourly Range: $21.00 - $34.52. McElhanney offers fair compensation that is commensurate with the individual’s education, experience, skills, and professional qualifications. The posted base salary range is representative of the required level of qualifications and experience for the position as noted in the job posting. The salary offered will be based on the experience and qualifications of the successful candidate. 

 What’s In It For You? 
You will embark on a rewarding journey with McElhanney, where your contributions will shape the future of our Talent Management initiatives. We are also proud to be listed as one of the Best Places to Work in Canada, one of the Top Employers in BC and we are recognized as Gold Standard for Best Managed Companies. 
Apply now to elevate your HR skills in a dynamic and collaborative environment. 
#LI-SA1 

 Our Commitment to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion 

 At McElhanney, our unwavering commitment lies in cultivating a culture that aligns with our core values and fosters diversity, equity, and inclusion. We celebrate the collective achievements of a team rich in expertise, experiences, and perspectives, and welcome applications from individuals of diverse ethnicities, religions, backgrounds, genders, sexual orientations, gender identities, aboriginal statuses, various age groups, and those with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process. If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements outlined. We’re interested in getting to know you and explore the unique contributions you can bring to McElhanney! 

 If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to learn more. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. 

 To learn more about our recognition as Canada's Top 100 Employers (2024), visit Top Employer: McElhanney Ltd. (canadastop100.com). 

 Visit us on Glassdoor to learn more about our employee experience. 

 Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people. 

 McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning. The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

companyInfo/companyDescription: WorkLink Employment Society is a growing non-profit organization that has provided government-sponsored employment services to the residents of the Victoria Capital Region’s Westshore (Colwood, Langford, Highlands, View Royal and Metchosin) since 1978. In 2008, services expanded to include the communities of Sooke and surrounding areas including Jordan River and Port Renfrew. WorkLink also provides Indigenous outreach services to the First Nations Communities of Beecher Bay, T’Souke and Pacheedaht. The non-profit organization is funded through both federal and provincial government initiatives. WorkLink is a registered charity in the Province of BC, which is governed by a volunteer Board of Directors chosen from leaders in the community.
description:
Are you a youth aged 18 - 30 who is ready to kick off your summer with hands-on experience and practical knowledge that matches your passion? If so, WorkLink Employment Society is pleased to announce the following 2024 Summer Employment Opportunities in conjunction with funding through the Government of Canada, Youth Summer Jobs Program:
Human Resources Support Specialist 

 35 hours/week | Monday – Friday | 9:00 am – 4:30 pm
 16 weeks
 Westshore Location
 $20.20 per hour

About The Society:
WorkLink has provided government-sponsored employment services to the residents of the Victoria Capital Region’s Westshore (Colwood, Langford, Highlands, View Royal, and Metchosin) since 1978. In 2008, our services expanded to include the communities of Sooke and surrounding areas including Jordan River and Port Renfrew. We are also pleased to provide Indigenous outreach services to the First Nations Communities of Beecher Bay, T’Souke, and Pacheedaht. Our non-profit organization is funded through both federal and provincial government initiatives. WorkLink is a registered charity in the Province of BC, which is governed by a volunteer Board of Directors chosen from leaders in the community.
About the Position:
The Human Resources Support Specialist will play a crucial role in delivering and developing Human Resource Products and Services to WorkLink employees and clients in the Social Enterprise Group. This support will provide opportunities for the Human Resource Support Specialist to work side by side and be mentored by Human Resource Professionals.
Key Duties for this position include:

 Conducts various Human Resources functions, involving onboarding and orientation, performance management, policies and procedures.
 Assists in correspondence and other HR documentation; transcribes material from rough copy, and may be required to perform basic editing and proofreading as requested.
 Assists in the creation of Workplace Culture Assessments and Investigations
 Provides support in developing training programs related to Human Resources and Leadership
 Participation in Hiring Programs and supporting HR on demand services with clients; and
 Provides clients with appropriate resources for employers.
 Compiles/prepares materials for training programs, employee orientation, interviews, and meetings as required.
 Ensures compliance with relevant privacy legislation and WorkSafe BC Health and Safety requirements.
 The Specialist will also actively participate in building a safe and healthy workplace founded in principles of Workplace Wellness, Psychological Safety in the Workplace and Bullying and Harassment prevention.
 Special projects around Health and Safety, training / development, and streamlining orientation initiatives.

Knowledge, skills, and abilities:

 Ability to prioritize tasks, manage tight deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced environment;
 Working cooperatively/effectively with others to share best practices that enhance organizational effectiveness;
 Excellent communication, initiative, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills;
 MS Office skills and knowledge of spreadsheets
 Proven ability to prioritize, problem solve, exercise initiative, and work independently and as a team member; and
 Strong active listening skills, with the ability to uphold and maintain confidentiality.

Preferred Qualifications:

 Currently pursuing a career in Human Resources studies and/or a related field.
 Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with others both internally and externally.
 Exemplary communication skills; research skills; demonstrated writing skills and technology skills; and Strong active listening skills with the ability to uphold and maintain confidentiality.

Eligibility:

 Able to demonstrate initiative and self-motivation.
 All applicants must be between the ages of 15-30 at the beginning of employment.
 Have a valid Social Insurance Number & be legally entitled to work in Canada (be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident).
 The successful candidate must have an outgoing personality and be able to communicate politely and professionally both verbally and in writing.

To Apply for this position:

 Please submit your cover letter and resumé through our online application as a PDF attachment through the link on our careers page at https://worklink.bc.ca/careers/
 This posting will remain in effect until the closing date of 4:00 pm on Mar 31, 2024
 Applications/uploaded resumes sent via social media platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, Facebook) will not be accepted.

We appreciate all applications, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
WorkLink values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. We foster a workplace where individual differences are recognized and respected while utilizing each person’s talents and strengths. 
The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be!

Innergex énergie renouvelable inc. est un producteur indépendant d'énergie renouvelable qui gère un important portefeuille d’actifs au Canada, aux États-Unis, en France et au Chili. La Société développe, acquiert, détient et exploite des centrales hydroélectriques, parcs éoliens, des parcs solaires et des installations de stockage d’énergie. 

Innergex croit en un monde dans lequel de l’énergie renouvelable abondante favorise des communautés plus saines et encourage le partage de la prospérité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Nous sommes convaincus que la production d’énergie à partir de sources renouvelables ouvrira la voie à un monde meilleur. Nous avons toujours à cœur de soutenir une croissance durable qui crée un rapport équilibré entre les personnes, notre planète et la prospérité. Nous croyons en la nécessité de proposer un environnement de travail motivant, inclusif et positif dans lequel chaque membre de l’équipe peut s’épanouir.

Les employés d'Innergex bénéficient de salaires compétitifs, d'avantages sociaux collectifs, d'un environnement de travail dynamique et de la chance de contribuer à créer un monde meilleur.

Innergex est un employeur qui offre des chances d’emploi égales pour tous et qui valorise les antécédents, la diversité, les expériences, les perspectives et les talents uniques de chaque personne. Innergex s’engage à fournir aux employés un environnement de travail sans discrimination ni harcèlement et fonde toutes les décisions en matière d’emploi sur les besoins de l’entreprise, les exigences de l’emploi et les qualifications individuelles. La clé de notre succès en tant qu’entreprise internationale est de recruter, de développer et de retenir les personnes les plus talentueuses parmi un bassin de candidats diversifié.

************************************************

Innergex Renewable Energy Inc. is an independent renewable energy producer with an extensive and growing portfolio of assets in Canada, the United States, France and Chile. The Corporation develops, acquires, owns and operates hydroelectric facilities, wind farms, solar farms and energy storage facilities. 

For 30 years, Innergex has believed in a world where abundant renewable energy promotes healthier communities and creates shared prosperity. We are convinced that generating power from renewable sources will lead the way to a better world. We remain committed to responsible growth that balances people, our planet, and prosperity. We believe in offering an engaging, inclusive and supportive work environment where each team member can thrive.
Innergex employees are offered competitive wages, group benefits, a dynamic work environment, and the opportunity to contribute to building a better world.

Innergex is an equal opportunity employer that values each person’s unique background, diversity, experiences, perspectives and talents. Innergex is committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment and bases all employment decisions on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. The key to our success as a global company is to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

Why should you join our team?

Innergex Renewable Energy Inc. is an independent renewable energy producer with an extensive and growing portfolio of assets in Canada, the United States, France and Chile. The Corporation develops, acquires, owns and operates hydroelectric facilities, wind farms, solar farms and energy storage facilities.

For more than 30 years, Innergex has believed in a world where abundant renewable energy promotes healthier communities and creates shared prosperity. We are convinced that generating power from renewable sources will lead the way to a better world. We remain committed to responsible growth that balances people, our planet, and prosperity. We believe in offering an engaging, inclusive and supportive work environment where each team member can thrive.

Your contribution!

Being a Co-op Student in the Hydro operations and maintenance team in Vancouver is to solve tough problems and support the facilities in ensuring 100% uptime. Your organizational and administrative skills, your autonomy, your ability to foster solid working relationships and your proactive nature makes you the ideal candidate.

Your day-to-day!

  • Collect and analyze Maintenance Management System data pertaining to equipment condition, criticality, age and costs: this includes collating data, administrating corrective and preventive work orders (issuing and closing), and developing Preventive Maintenance plans for future operations, maintenance, and growth;
  • Use software (Tableau and MATLAB) to query relational databases and spreadsheets and generate graph-type data visualizations;
  • Intermediate skills in Excel required and basic experience with VBA, an asset;
  • Assisting in Operations and Maintenance administration tasks, including (but not limited to): formatting and compiling reports, gathering information, managing data files, drafting proposals, drafting correspondence, tracking operations metrics, processing, reviewing, and filing work orders, and generating maintenance reports;
  • Participating in site visits when required;
  • Completing additional Operations tasks as required.
  • Supporting Innergex’s corporate Environment, Health and Safety procedures and policies;
  • Completing additional Operations tasks as required.
  • Collect and analyze Maintenance Management System data pertaining to equipment condition, criticality, age and costs: this includes collating data, administrating corrective and preventive work orders (issuing and closing), and developing Preventive Maintenance plans for future operations, maintenance, and growth;
  • Use software (Tableau and MATLAB) to query relational databases and spreadsheets and generate graph-type data visualizations;

Your skills, our requirements!

  • In progress towards earning a degree in Engineering or other related field;
  • Previous co-op experience is preferred;
  • Must possess a valid unrestricted class 5 driver's licence;
  • Basic experience with Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS) and maintenance program administration;
  • Experience with MATLAB and/or Tableau is an asset;
  • Basic experience with CAD tools, and 3D modelling software packages is an asset.

Additional considerations!

  • The position is based at our downtown Vancouver (BC) office;
  • You need to be able to travel to facilities in British Columbia, some of which are located on remote sites.

Pay Transparency Statement
Compensation for roles at Innergex varies depending on a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, education, and level of experience. We believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current team members as a part of any final offer.

The salary range for this internship is between 18$ and 25$ per hour.

Our benefits!

  • Hybrid work model;
  • Career development opportunities;
  • Offices accessible by public transportation.

Innergex is an equal opportunity employer that values each person’s unique background, diversity, experiences, perspectives and talents. Innergex is committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment and bases all employment decisions on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. The key to our success as a global company is to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.
